abstract.text: An Operation is a computed parameter that can be passed to other operations in the same operation node
Dummy trigger
Gate based linear AHD envelope generator
Faust-based pink noise generator
Initialize the operation as a constant value
Classic FM Synthesis audio generation.
Simple square oscillator, not-band limited, can be used for LFO or wave,
but squareWave is probably better for audio.
Returns a frequency for a given MIDI note number
Increment a signal by a default value of 1
Initialize the operation with a Sporth string
Simple reverse sawtooth oscillator, not-band limited, can be used for LFO or wave.
Redefining description to return the operation string
Initialize the operation
Standard Sine Wave
A signal with random fluctuations
This is useful for emulating jitter found in analogue equipment.
Subtraction of parameters
Division of parameters
Left input to any stereo operation
OperationParameters are simply arguments that can be passed into ComputedParameters
These could be numbers (floats, doubles, ints) or other operations themselves
Since parameters can be audio in mono or stereo format, the protocol
requires that an OperationParameter defines method to switch between stereo and mono
Keep track of the number of times a trigger has fired
Line segments with vertices at random points
Metro produces a series of 1-sample ticks at a regular rate. Typically, this
is used alongside trigger-driven modules.
An Operation is a computed parameter that can be passed to other operations in the same operation node
Trigger based linear AHD envelope generator
Offsetting by way of multiplication
Rounds the operation to the nearest integer
Save a value into the parameters array for using outside of the operation
Morphing Oscillator
Simple sawtooth oscillator, not-band limited, can be used for LFO or wave,
but sawtoothWave is probably better for audio.
Performs natural logarithm on the operation
White noise generator
Line Segment to change values over time
Performs floor calculation on the operation
This is a bandlimited triangle oscillator
ported from the “triangle” function from the Faust programming language.
Scaled noise sent through a classic sample and hold module.
This scales from -1 to 1 to a range defined by a minimum and maximum point in the input and output domain.
Karplus-Strong plucked string instrument.
A computed parameter differs from a regular parameter in that it only exists within an operation
(unlike float, doubles, and ints which have a value outside of an operation)
Performs Base 10 logarithm on the operation
Simple triangle oscillator, not-band limited, can be used for LFO or wave,
but triangleWave is probably better for audio.
Convert the operation to a mono operation
Multiplication of parameters
Brownian noise generator
This is a bandlimited square oscillator ported from the “square” function
from the Faust programming language.
Produces a normalized sawtooth wave between the values of 0 and 1. Phasors
are often used when building table-lookup oscillators.
Offsetting by way of addition
Exponential Segment to change values over time
Produce a set of triggers spaced apart by time.
Performs absolute value on the operation
Karplus-Strong plucked string instrument.
Addition/Summation of operations
Portamento-style control signal smoothing
Useful for smoothing out low-resolution signals and applying glissando to
filters.
Bandlimited sawtooth oscillator This is a bandlimited sawtooth oscillator
ported from the “sawtooth” function from the Faust programming language.
An= array of 14 parameters which may be sent to operations
Right input to any stereo operation
Returns the fractional part of the operation (as opposed to the integer part)
